<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 559, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 561, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 437, 153]]<|/det|>
**Experiment A (cooling with stirring)**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 146, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

Experiment C (cooling with a lid) and Experiment D (cooling without a lid)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 275, 148, 293]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 275, 875, 310]]<|/det|>
The student pours approximately \(200 \text{cm}^3\) of the hot water into each of two beakers. The initial temperature of the water in each beaker is \(\theta_1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 863, 341]]<|/det|>
She places a lid on one of the beakers. She allows both beakers to cool for 5 minutes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 352, 779, 373]]<|/det|>
At the end of the cooling period, she calculates the temperature differences.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 383, 871, 408]]<|/det|>
\[\text{temperature difference of } \mathbf{C} \text{ (with a lid)} = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (3)\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 420, 871, 445]]<|/det|>
\[\text{temperature difference of } \mathbf{D} \text{ (without a lid)} = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (4)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 459, 875, 495]]<|/det|>
